newsitem.title: BURUNDI: Burundi army reports heavy fighting in Zaire.
newsitem.headline: Burundi army reports heavy fighting in Zaire.

text.p: Banyamulenge Tutsi rebels battled Zaire's army on Friday for control of the eastern city of Uvira, a Burundian army spokesman said.

Lieutenant-Colonel John Bosco Daradangwe told Reuters the fighting was continuing. Another Burundian military officer who declined to be named said rebels had taken the Zairean frontier town of Vugizo.
The Banyamulenge are an ethnic Tutsi group which came to what is now Zaire from what is now Rwanda as long ago as the end of the 18th century. Fighting has raged in South Kivu for a week.
"Right up to this moment there is fighting going on around Uvira. The fighting has been going on all day," Daradangwe said.

Aid workers confirmed heavy fighting in Uvira and said a local U.N. radio operator in the city reported on Thursday night he would have to stop transmitting as the rebels were about to take the area. He then went off the air.
Another Burundian officer said the rebels seized a border post at Vugizo earlier on Friday but Uvira had not fallen.
